articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian air defences were engaged on Monday in repelling a rare daytime Russian missile attack on the capital Kyiv and other cities across the country, local authorities said.
articles.title: Ukrainian air defence engaged in repelling Russian missile attack on Kyiv, officials

articles.author: Tyler Clifford
articles.description: Hurricane Beryl made landfall near the coastal town of Matagorda in Texas early on Monday, pounding coastal areas with dangerous storm surges, strong winds and heavy rain as it moved inland, the U.S. National Hurricane Center (NHC) said.
articles.title: Hurricane Beryl expected to weaken quickly as it churns across Texas

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces pounded Gaza City early on Monday, sending columns of tanks into the heart of the city from different directions in what residents said was one of the heaviest attacks since Oct 7.
articles.title: Israeli tanks storm Gaza City districts, residents report heavy fire

articles.author: Richard Lough
articles.description: France faced a hung parliament and the prospect of taxing negotiations starting Monday to form a government, after a surprise left-wing surge blocked Marine Le Pen's quest to bring the far right to power.
articles.title: France shifts to the left, but risk of policy paralysis looms

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin welcomed Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi late on Monday and toured him around his residence outside Moscow ahead of official talks in the Kremlin on Tuesday.
articles.title: Putin, Modi hold informal talks at Kremlin leader's residence

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden is not being treated for Parkinson's disease, the White House said on Monday, after reports surfaced that a doctor specializing in the malady had visited the White House eight times over the past year.
articles.title: Biden is not being treated for Parkinson's, White House says

articles.author: Joe Cash, Anita Komuves
articles.description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban met Chinese President Xi Jinping on Monday to discuss a potential Ukraine peace deal, paying the unexpected visit to Beijing days after his talks with Russia's Vladimir Putin angered some European Union leaders.
articles.title: Hungary's Orban unexpectedly visits China, backs Xi's peace plan

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden said on Monday that deadly Russian missile strikes in Ukraine, including on the main children's hospital in Kyiv, were "a horrific reminder of Russia's brutality."
articles.title: Biden says deadly missile strikes are 'horrific reminder of Russia's brutality'

articles.author: Kim Kyung-Hoon, Satoshi Sugiyama
articles.description: Unable to get married legally in Japan, LGBTQ couples are celebrating their special bond by donning traditional kimonos and fashionable formal wear for elaborate "photo weddings".
articles.title: Frustrated by Japan's same-sex marriage ban, LGBTQ couples opt for 'photo weddings'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Russian court sentenced a playwright and a theatre director each to six years in prison on Monday for "justifying terrorism", concluding a trial that rights campaigners had said demonstrated Russia's intolerance of artistic freedom.
articles.title: Russia sentences director, playwright to 6 years for 'justifying terrorism'
